meanings.sent1: I will change my clothes before going out.
meanings.sent2: She decided to change her hairstyle for a new look.
meanings.sent3: Why did the tomato refuse to change? Because it saw the salad dressing!
meanings.sent4: The caterpillar changed into a beautiful butterfly.
meanings.sent5: The weather can change quickly in spring.

meanings.definition: The act or process of making or becoming different
meanings.sent1: The change in weather caught us by surprise.
meanings.sent2: He believed that change was necessary for growth.
meanings.sent3: Why did the math book look forward to change? It wanted to solve its problems!
meanings.sent4: The change in her attitude was noticeable to everyone.
meanings.sent5: The change in scenery refreshed his mind.

meanings.definition: Money given in exchange for a larger denomination
meanings.sent1: She needed to get change for the parking meter.
meanings.sent2: He exchanged his dollars for coins at the bank for the parking meter.
meanings.sent3: Why did the penny feel out of place among the change? It was feeling a bit 'copper'-sick!
meanings.sent4: The vending machine only accepted exact change.
meanings.sent5: He always kept spare change in his pocket for emergencies.
